Note:
See also 2489; for a Latin version, see Wright (1841)
XWright, Thomas. The Latin Poems Commonly Attributed to Walter Mapes.
Camden Society o.s. 16 (1841), 226.
_description: ‘Sir Peny’ — five quatrains (aaab) and burden: ‘Go bet peny go bet go / For þou mat makyn bothe frynd & fo’

BLSl2593.First Lines: Peny is an hardy knyghtPeny is mekyl of myght…
BLSl2593.Last Lines:
…Of me þei holdyn but lytil forsHe was a man let hym
                    goo
